questions.question: What is the molecular weight of the synthesized gold cluster compound?
What type of crystal system does the synthesized gold cluster compound belong to?
What is the space group of the synthesized gold cluster compound?
What is the density (Dx) of the synthesized gold cluster compound?
What is the volume (V) of the unit cell of the synthesized gold cluster compound?
What is the shortest Au-Au interatomic distance in the synthesized gold cluster compound?
Based on the synthesis conditions, what method was used to solve the structure of the gold cluster compound?
questions.answer: The structure was solved by direct methods using MULTAN.

questions.question: What was the method used for absorption corrections in the synthesis of the gold cluster compound?
questions.answer: Absorption corrections were based on Y scans of reflections near x=90Â°.

questions.question: How were the Au and S atoms refined in the synthesis process of the gold cluster compound?
questions.answer: Au and S atoms were refined anisotropically.

questions.question: What was the maximum shift in the final cycle of refinement for the gold cluster compound?
What was the largest residual density found in the synthesis of the gold cluster compound?
What type of radiation was used in the data collection for the gold cluster compound?
The crystal size of the synthesized gold cluster compound was 0.06 x 0.06 x 0.42 mm.
The gold cluster compound was refined using a half matrix least squares method.
The minimum relative transmission coefficient was below 75%.
Methyl H atoms were located in the structure of the gold cluster compound.
The gold cluster compound has a monoclinic crystal system and belongs to the space group P2_1/c.
The structure of the gold cluster compound was solved using indirect methods.
